page.title: 19Rogart - Transport (Railway)
page.content: Mr Mackay, Acheilidh, is the station manager. Fourteen men are employed by British Rail in Rogart. Eleven of them keep the railway line in good condition while the other three man the station. Daily, except Sunday, six passenger trains and two goods trains use this request stop. Passengers indicate to the train driver if they wish him to stop. Trains go north to Wick or Thurso and suoth to Inverness. The station has been open for a hundred years. In the summer,trains travel seven days a week. Sometimes, British Rail's Highland answer to the Orient Express pulls into Rogart. The points in Rogart are worked by a key system. This system prevents more than one train being in the system at one time.
